title: With elephantine stealth, Catherine Brenner returns
text:
Did anyone miss the report of former AMP chairman Catherine Brenner “quietly returning to corporate life” in Wednesday’s edition of The Australian?

This characterisation was, of course, profoundly misleading. Brenner has merely joined the George Institute for Global Health. By no definition does a medical research institute qualify as corporate. Nor does its divulgence in a national newspaper pass as “quietly”.

Indeed, only a client of Sue Cato’s could find themselves the subject of an “exclusive” story in which they were unavailable for comment.

For excruciating inelegance, the naked rehabilitation attempt was up there with the May 2018 column – also in The Oz – in which Cato met Brenner for solidarity coffee outside Chifley Towers. A News Corp photographer just so happened to be standing by. Marvel at the elephantine stealth of 1990s PR.

Here’s hoping Brenner’s actual return to corporate life looks a great deal less torturous than this.
description: Only a client of Sue Cato’s could find themselves the subject of an “exclusive” story in which they were unavailable for comment.
